resources.string: You must be wary in these parts, traveler. The nearby farm has fallen to the Lost. \n\nIf you value your soul, I would suggest staying safely behind the walls in town.

Greetings traveler, you have the air of one new to Aeternum, so I pray the fires of hope still burn within your heart. \n\nI have taken on a daunting quest to bring aid to the needy… but I am the one now in need of assistance.
Hope and Service
Covenant Initiation Quest: Florina has requested you aid Feldan save what you can at Olcott Farm and then meet her at the Church in Everfall.
"What do you need help with?"

It's painful to admit, but when the Olcott farm fell to the Lost, I offered to help them reclaim their valuables. \n\nI came here with the old man, Felden Olcott, but the Withered are too many. I had no choice but to run.
"What about Felden?"

He refuses to flee, and I'm too shaken to go back. Please speak with him, and get him to leave before he too becomes Lost. \n\nYou must convince him--it's not worth risking his soul for a handful of material possessions.
Please, convince old man Olcott to leave. \n\nIf I don't get him back to town safely... well, I couldn't bear it.
Decades, nearly a century we worked this land, only to have it fall to the Lost. \n\nMy family took refuge in town, but we have nothing beyond the clothes we wore when we fled.
"Initiate Florina sent me to talk to you."

Young Florina? This whole venture was her idea. Save your breath, stranger. I'm not leaving with nothing to show for it. \n\nI don't care about the coin, but the memories… if you help me reclaim our keepsakes, I'll go.
"I'll help. You get to safety."
I'll be safe enough right here until you get back. I've dealt with the Lost before. \n\nIf you take too long, I'll come in there myself. This is still my farm, you know.
If you hope to convince me to leave empty-handed, you're wasting your breath. \n\nRecover at least some of our family's things… then I will go with you.
Well now, I was having doubts, but here you are, just as you promised. This… means a lot. \n\nCovenant Initiate Florina returned to Oxboro… discouraged. Perhaps you should speak with her.

So you made it out of the farm with your soul intact? And I suppose you reclaimed the Olcotts' keepsakes as well? \n\nI am ashamed - you kept faith and came through, where I failed. Perhaps I am not Covenant material.
"What is the Covenant?"
The Covenant is an order of Templars sworn to battle on Aeternum to keep the spark of hope alive… for all eternity. \n\nFrom what I've witnessed, you belong as one of us.
Speak with Feldan Olcott
Recover Olcott Family Memories:
Reclaim Keepsakes from supply chests
Collect a Locket from one of the Lost
Collect the Town Crest
Bring the Family Memories to Feldan Olcott
Talk to Florina in Oxboro

I'll return once I have tended to the needs of those stranded here in Oxboro. \n\nI do hope we can meet later, in southeastern Everfall at the enclave. My brother is there, and I think you two would get along.

I strongly recommend that you visit the Covenant Enclave yourself. There is something inspiring about the place. \n\nIn fact, if you don't mind, it would help me greatly if you could take a message to my brother there, Lethold.
The Covenant Enclave

Covenant Initiation Quest: Florina has asked you to visit her brother Lethold at the Covenant enclave in south-eastern Everfall. She has attuned your spirit with the shrine, so you may travel there safely.
"I can do that. What's the message?"

Thank you. Lethold undoubtedly worries for my welfare, so please reassure him. \n\nI committed to helping people here in Oxboro for my Covenant initiation, and there's more to be done. Hopefully, I'll see you both at the enclave soon.
I really do suggest you inquire about becoming a Covenant Initiate yourself. \n\nOn Aeternum, it's critical one finds a higher purpose to serve.
Please, good visitor, tell me, have you come from Oxboro? \n\nMy dear sister Florina embarked on a quest there some time ago, and I am anxious to hear word of her welfare.
"She's still helping people and will return soon."

Ah, that's an immense relief to hear. It is inspiring to watch new Initiates face the trials of joining the Covenant. \n\nBut when it's one's younger sister, it is impossible not to feel some apprehension.
Travel to the Covenant Enclave
Travel to the Covenant Enclave
Use the Spirit Shrine (Optional)
Covenant Enclave
If you need shelter, the Covenant Enclave is open to you, as long as you observe our rules. \n\nAny news from Oxboro? I am awaiting the return of an Initiate named Florina.

If you have come with hopeful dreams of enlisting with the Covenant yourself, it's only fair you know what you're getting into. \n\nA wraith stalks the lands, and some Initiates gave into fear and are now in even greater peril.
Justice and Courage
Covenant Initiation Quest: Lethold beseeches you to rush to Clearview Crypt to end whatever terrible acts are transpiring, save Templar Damiano, and return to him at the Covenant Enclave.
"What happened to the Initiates?"

Their cowardice has very likely led them to a dark fate, though it is neither surprising nor unjust. \n\nIt appears that in their mad flight, they sought refuge in Clearview Crypt, which has now become disturbingly quiet.
"I could go check it out."

Now there's courage! I should warn you, however, Lumen Morellus believes the Initiates engaged in heretical behavior. \n\nTemplar Damiano went after them, but he has not returned. So go then, newcomer. I have a good feeling about you.
I must consult with Lumen Morellus about this alleged heresy. \n\nI hope you find Damiano, and the Initiates as well. I pray they are still whole.

The fortitude of Templar Damiano is proven by his safe return, though it is your courage that saved him. \n\nIt sounds like justice was served with the Initiates. But I wonder, how did they succumb to become Corrupted?
"I found this grimoire."

So they embraced the darkness of their own accord? Then I can only hope they suffered at your hand. \n\nI will gather any of the Initiates's belongings remaining in the Enclave and see them purged by fire.
Investigate and cleanse Clearview Crypt
Head to Clearview Crypt
Search for Evidence explaining how the Initiates became Corrupted
Free Templar Damiano
Purge Corrupted Presence

Lumen Morellus would speak with you. She can seem strange, but she is one of the most respected members of the order. \n\nShe was my mentor, and I suggest you give great consideration to her words, for she is inspired.
The Lumen's Words
Covenant Initiation Quest: Adjudicator Lethold has asked you to speak with Lumen Morellus at the Covenant Enclave for your final initiation test.
"I will listen carefully."
Very well. I must attend to cleansing the foul presence of those Initiates from our sacred halls. \n\nWhen Florina returns, I hope all this is far behind us.
I suggest you speak with the Lumen soon. \n\nThere is no reason to delay.
I have faced down all manner of darkness in my service to the Covenant. \n\nBut when such darkness comes from within our ranks, it wounds me more than any blade ever could.

You are welcome in the Covenant Hall, visitor. We keep our gates open at all hours to ensure those in despair or doubt can find the santuary they need. \n\nRemember, it only takes a spark of hope to ignite the flames of inspiration.

Thank you for giving me this chance to express my gratitude for the rescue of Templar Damiano. \n\nI see in your eyes the light of a great potential. You would shine as a member of our order, and bring inspiration to many struggling souls.
Speak with Morellus.

Be assured, you are under no pressure to join the Covenant, but you have provided us with a strong case concerning your worthiness. \n\nI must ask, however, if you can help me with another matter, one requiring some discretion.
Inspiration and Redemption
Covenant Initiation Quest: Morellus has enlisted you to lure the Corrupted Templar back to Nettlerest Graveyard, best him in battle, collect his cursed necklace, and return to the Convenant Enclave.
"I can be trusted in such things."

I expected as much. The problem I need help with is related to Templar Titus Invectus, the one who oversaw the training of our fallen Initiates. \n\nI'm afraid this has driven Titus quite mad, and he, too, is now Corrupted, but through no fault of his own.
"It's spreading…?"

No, because we won't allow that. Paranoia and rage make one susceptible to Corruption, and that's why we'll keep this between us. \n\nThe fallen Initiates apparently corrupted the relic Titus wore as a necklace, and we must recover it and destroy it, quickly and quietly.
"How do we do that?"

Templar Invectus lurks somewhere in Nettlerest Graveyard - there's an old marker there he studied. It should lure him out. \n\nDefeat Invectus, bring back the corrupted relic, and then we can destroy it. Lethold is wrathful enough already.
I strongly suggest you do not attempt to use the relic. \n\nIt is an insidious poison, Corruption.
You have recovered the relic from Invectus? \n\nGo now, don't say a word. Simply cast it into the pyre.
There, now we can safely say this whole sordid affair is concluded with some measure of redemption. \n\nLethold is a champion of righteousness and justice, and a strong leader.
"Are you sure he shouldn't know?"

Quite. The Covenant is as much about preserving hope as it is about seeing justice done. \n\nIt is better for all of us that Lethold stays focused on the future, no need to dwell on these dark events.
Summon Titus Invectus
Investigate the Nettlerest Graveyard
Align the first stone
Align the second stone
Align the final stone
Defeat Lost Spirits to Charge the Marker
Defeat Lost Spirits to Charge the Marker
Set the Ritual Marker
Complete the Ritual
Reclaim the Corrupted Templar's Amulet
Reclaim the Corrupted Templar's Amulet
Talk to Morellus
Destroy the Relic
You have proven yourself to be faithful and courageous, an inspiration for any whose souls are in peril. \n\nI hope you will consider joining our order, swearing your allegiance to the Covenant.

We must understand the nature of this Corruption and its dark purpose. \n\nThe shadow clouding these lands feels… strangely orchestrated. Focus, follow the threads, trust your heart and your Covenant brethren.
If it comes to it, I will stand stalwartly by you and hold this keep until they’ve ground the last brick to dust. \n\nIn this era of unprecedented darkness, you are a beacon of hope and inspiration.

Together, we have seen justice done, terror and despair purged from within our own ranks. \n\nI do hope you will consider committing your skills and courage to the Covenant. You belong with us, friend.
We must remain vigilant, always. \n\nYou and I both know only too well, evil can emerge anywhere, even from within our own ranks.
I have learned much from you in your time here. \n\nTo protect others, we must do so much more than simply keeping them from harm. Thank you, for leading by example.
At long last I return from Oxboro. I faltered at Olcott farm. \n\nYou have my eternal thanks for being there to back me up.
We are stronger with you by our side. Holding this terrace, none of those Lost could get past us! \n\nAeternum is brighter with you out there, helping the humblest souls.

I've heard stories, from the battle against Corruption. It's too horrible to believe. \n\nI once thought that I could save everyone. But that's not the point, is it? It's about helping who we can. That's all we can do.
The whole enclave is talking about what you've been doing around here! I can't believe we met on the side of a road. \n\nI believe it's time you officially became one of us. What do you say?
Committing to the Cause
Covenant Recruitment: You can now join the Covenant.
"Alright. Where do I sign up?"

I am thrilled to hear you affirm your interest. The Covenant will shine brighter with you standing in our ranks. \n\nGo and speak to Lumen Beyza. I have already vouched for your worthiness. And hope be with you… always.
Take your time, this is not a decision to be made lightly.
N/A
Pledge your allegiance to The Covenant
Speak with representative Beyza in the Covenant Enclave and, should you desire, join the Covenant.
(Optional) Decline their offer, for now.
"Thanks, but I'm still considering my options."

I understand. It is an important decision. Should you wish to join our ranks another time, simply speak with me again.

I know Florina would love to hear from you as well.

(You can talk to this representative again if you would like to join this faction. If you've already joined another faction, you may also now switch to this faction through the Bio menu.)
Azoth Time Trial
Complete the Azoth Time Trial.
Stay resolute.
No. . . something isn't right. . . \n\nWhy can't I remember what his face looked like?
Don't get too close there, friend. \n\nThe paint isn't quite dry yet, and I'd hate to stain my hands with your blood.
Hm? A potential Initiate? If you value strength, listen well. \n\nDo not strike out at whatever suits you in the moment. True power comes from giving that strength a purpose.
How goes the hunt? What wickedness have you put to rest?
Feel free to grab some soup, hon. \n\nIt gets mighty chilly up here and you'll need something to keep warm.
Good to see you again, hon. \n\nI mainly keep this kitchen running for outsiders, but you can still help yourself any time.
Praise the light! My hope was fading fast! I can make it back to the enclave now!
You have my deepest appreciation for saving me from that foul crypt. \n\nThe more we learn about Corruption, the more I understand the things I saw in that cave. What I could have become…
I knew someone like you could not resist our noble cause. \n\nThe land of Aeternum will be made brighter by your strength. Stay resolute!
Welcome to the Covenant Enclave. It's a pleasure, but you haven't arrived at the best time... \n\nIf you are inclined to join the Covenant, you will need to prove yourself worthy first.
I'd ask you to reconsider your faction alignment, but according the the Pact we cannot recruit you for another {factionCooldownDays} days.
I'd ask you to reconsider your faction alignment, but according the the Pact we cannot recruit you for one more day.

Based on what I've heard from Adjudicator Lethold and Lumen Morellus, your courage is incontestable. \n\nIf you are ready to swear your allegiance to the Covenant, we would welcome you into the Order.

Now that you have joined our righteous ranks, you'll find we have ample opportunity for spreading the light. \n\nMissions are always available here and anywhere on Aeternum where our banner flies. I have Covenant gear, as well.
We'll use all the aid we can get. \n\nOr, perhaps you would enlist in an even greater conflict?

Hey! Aren't you a little young to be in here? 

Don't get touchy, just a wee bit of Aeternum humor for ya! 

And fear not mate, I'm as discreet as a privy guard!

Slide on over, friend! You look like one of them Marauder types. Like adventure? Maybe a bit of a scrap, aye? How about weapons and riches? \n\nHow’d you like a little tip from ol’ Tibbs? I’ve got something perfect for a new arrival.
A First Step of Many

Marauder Initiation Quest: Lieutenant Tibbs wants you to collect Lost Ears and a Knight's Signet ring at Lugdunum Fields for some sort of magic and then meet him at the ruin steps to the North of the farm.
"All right, you've got my attention."

That’s the spirit! Northwest's a fort filled with unbelievable wonders. Need odd things to get inside. Magic, you see. Ears from the soulless Lost, a ring from a knight. \n\nGrab that lot from Lugdunum Fields, and meet me there.

Oi! Won’t get far loitering around here with these louts! Look, you get them ears, and I promise, I’ll show you something special, sure as my name's Tibbs. \n\nYou know what they all say! Always trust a Tibbs!

Oh-ho, that looks like a bag of ears to me! You can… leave that there. Now show us the ring… Well done! \n\nYou’ve got a strong stomach and bravado! I got an eye for it, I do. Climb the steps, and talk to Gladiator Strou'dahia.

Tibbs spoke of you. He's odd, but fearless. He has a unique notion of what constitutes honor, but he's a sharp fighter, keeps his enemies off-guard. \n\nIndividual freedom is as important to a Marauder as honor and glory.
"Tell me more about the Marauders."

We Marauders are a band of warriors united, seeking glory and honor in battle. \n\nIf you have the spine to stand with us, we may help you to know yourself, both your potential and your limitations. Tibbs is your guide, for now.

Don’t give me that look, this place is FULL of wonders! Look at me, looking at you, eh! \n\nThe Marauders are my kind of soldiers, see. Family now. And I think you should join our crew. Now, how about another tip from Tibbs?
“You mean like your first tip?"

Don't be like that! Had to put you to a little test, didn’t I? Or Strou'dahia would chew you up and spit you out. She's a tougher sort. \n\nHere now, let's be friends. Have a reward for putting up with me!
Follow Tibb's instructions then meet him at the ruins
Collect items from Lugdunum Fields
Speak with Tibbs near the ruins
Explore the Marauder Enclave
Slay Lost for their Ears
Collect a Signet Ring from a Lost Knight
Talk to Lieutenant Tibbs
Climb the steps into the fortress courtyard
Marauder Enclave
Talk to Gladiator Strou'dahia
Walk the grounds and watch. Warriors must train every day, especially on Aeternum. \n\nIf you want to keep up, you will have to prove yourself and challenge your limits.

Look, I like you mate! And I know what Strou'dahia has cooking for the new recruits. \n\nAnd if you’re keen, you could start off with a bang! Short trip, little warmup, eh? Better loot than Lugdunum to boot.
Fortune Favors
Marauder Initiation Quest: Lieutenant Tibbs has directed you to thrash some pirates and steal some black powder barrels at the Pirate Stockpile and then return to the Marauders Enclave.
"Say ears one more time…"

Oi, no, no! Though it is Lost again. Pirates round here, always a pain in our side. \n\nTracked some of them down yesterday. Northeast, hiding like rats. Fight ’em, plunder ’em, burn their claim, and take their boom.

Those powder barrels, aye? We’ll be using those to impress Strou'dahia in the next step of our little plan. \n\nThe rest of the ruckus should let them know we mean business. Crash into that cave and plunder away!
Oh ho! Someone's got a mess of booty! Hope you gave those blackguards a good walloping. \n\nHow’s the prize? Ten percent for me then, eh? Fee, tax, and all.
"These were heavy."

A little manual labor’s good for you! Now just remember where you’re off to next. \n\nReal rough ones always resurrect, aye? Need a more permanent answer. Plant those barrels near their inner bulwarks, then run like hell!
Raid the Pirate Stockpile
Discipline the Pirates
Plunder the Pirate Hoard
Burn the Pirate Banners
Collect Black Powder Barrels
We got ourselves a little quid pro quo with Everfall, keeping the Lost out of the hills and off their doorstep. \n\nEarns a drink or two. Next one is on Tibbs' tab, eh? Good luck out there!

You've made it this far mate, and I can tell you'll fit right in. \n\nStrou'dahia wants to test your mettle if you're gonna join us. Swing some steel, blow those bombs, it'll be over in a flash. Recruitment procedures you see.
Threshold Guardian
Marauder Initiation Quest: Lieutenant Tibbs has asked you to speak with Gladiator Strou'dahia at the Marauder Enclave for your final initiation test.
"Sounds like my kind of test."
Oh ho! There it is! Those bombs ain't the only things with spark! \n\nNow, go talk to Gladiator Strou'dahia, and show the Marauders what you've got!
Off you trot, mate. Talk to the Doctore and I'll await your return.
Good, stand before me. You have fought boldly so far. Should you wish to join our ranks I have one final test of strength and skill. \n\nIt is time. Let us begin.
Speak with Gladiator Strou'Dahia

When the Varangians first snuck up the cliffs and took Stonekeep, I thought them worthy opponents. Now they attack those weaker than them and forfeit any honor. \n\nWhat about you? Would you bleed for the Marauders' cause?
Broken Bones and Blasted Bulwarks

Marauder Initiation Quest: Gladiator Stroudahia has ordered you to best Varangians and rescue captives at Stonereach Keep. You must also complete Tibb's secret mission, before returning to the Marauders' Enclave
"I would fight for glory."

The Varangians have begun to take some of our members prisoner. No Marauder lets their brethren stay in chains. \n\nFree the imprisoned recruits who were less fortunate, and take the Varangian Knights down a peg. Make them feel our wrath!
Were it you in captivity, you would hope for a quicker rescue? Suffering festers through inaction. \n\nMove with purpose, and guide your steel relentlessly towards your goals.
Those who would risk themselves to save their comrades are always welcome in the Marauders. \n\nWe always stand together, always look after our own. Now, I know I can trust you in battle.
“Nobody deserves to be a Varangian captive."

Your little addendum to your mission was noted. That’s the third message Tibbs has sent. \n\nHe’s an acquired taste, but a loyal and trustworthy ally. Should you wish to join us, Smiggs can enter you into our charters.
Lay Waste to Stonereach Keep
Complete The Objectives
Special Mission Tibbs:
Set the Explosives
Scout Stonereach Keep for Targets
Rescue the Marauder Recruit
Rescue the Marauder Guard
Rescue the Marauder Hedge
Best Varangian Knights in Combat
Plant Explosive at the Eastern Tower
Plant Explosive at the Western Tower
Return to the Marauder Enclave
You have proven yourself a valiant warrior, and have friends here for what you have done. \n\nEternity is a long time. Consider spending it with us. There will never be a dull moment.
The challenges you face in these lands will mold you. Forge yourself intently, young one. \n\nStand strong alongside your friends. Make your enemies fear your might.

You have shaped yourself into a mighty warrior. \n\nNever forget, we are both the iron and the blacksmith, and the act of forging ourselves is never ending. Hold firm in your mind what you must become.
Well done! Well done indeed! No doubt the fancy folk down in Everfall are all abuzz about that last escapade, my friend. \n\nReckon I'll be telling that story for an… Aeternity. Eh? Eh?
Did I not say it from the start? I knew you would like it here, mate. \n\nAnd always getting stronger, aint'cha? I look forward to the mayhem we'll bring.

Quite the journey since you first got here. Never could have seen how far you would go. And you, you were mad at me over a few ears! \n\nAnd look at us now! Always got your back, friend, through thick and thin.
UNUSED
The Syndicate. The Covenant. Neither suit a combatant of your temperament. \n\nJoin our ranks and become a warrior of legend in these eternal lands.
One of Us
Marauders Recruitment Quest: You can now join the Marauders.
"Alright. Where would I enlist?"
This is good to hear. I would be honored to fight beside you in the battles ahead. \n\nI've already spoken with Smiggs. Go to him and he will enter you into our charters.
Go to Smiggs with haste. Tonight, we feast!
n/a
Pledge your allegiance to The Marauders.
Speak with representative Smiggs in the Marauder Enclave and, should you desire, join the Marauders.
(Optional) Decline their offer, for now.
"Thanks, but I'm still considering my options."

I understand. It is an important decision. Should you wish to join our ranks another time, return and speak with me.

We always love to see an old mate.

(You can talk to this representative again if you would like to join this faction. If you've already joined another faction, you may also now switch to this faction through the Bio menu.)
Go with honor.
Scram! Food's for Marauders only. \n\nIf you want to be fed around here, you gotta earn it.
Aye, welcome back and indeed welcome to the crew. \n\nThere'll be enough stew to feed an army, help yourself any time.
You are new here, yes? Stick around and maybe you learn how to lift.
Keep lifting, trainee. Don't let "good enough" be good enough.
Not sick, are you? \n\nI don't have the time to treat outsiders unless you need something amputated. Always have time for that.
As a fellow Marauder, I am required to tell you that I may render first aid upon request. I am not required to tell you how much it will hurt. \n\nDon't forget you come back when you die…
I'm getting out of here before they shove me back in!
Never want to be stuck in a box again. Never thought it could happen to me. One bonk to the head, and BAM! \n\nThanks again for the spring!
They still let me join, even after getting stuck. Perks of being friends with the rep, I suppose. \n\nI better pay attention and practice.
Once I finish my training, we are going to absolutely SMASH!
If you would like to join our crew, you will first need to make your plea to Strou'dahia. \n\nYou will be challenged, so be prepared.
I'd ask you to reconsider your faction alignment, but according the the Pact we cannot recruit you for another {factionCooldownDays} days.
I'd ask you to reconsider your faction alignment, but according the the Pact we cannot recruit you for one more day.

From the first, we knew you were one of us. It's in the way you carry yourself, you see? \n\nStrou'dahia has vouched for your valor, so it's time. Pledge our oaths and join our ranks, the choice is yours.
Hail, warrior! You are a credit to our ranks. \n\nDo you seek more glory? Look no further. Missions are available here and anywhere else our banner flies. I also have arms and armor, if you need.
Aye, looking strong. Which noble cause draws you? \n\nOr, perhaps you seek assignment to even greater conflict?
Mind your step. There are some unnatural beasts in the area. \n\nYou should return to the safety of the walls. Everfall has been more dangerous as of late.
Please, if you wouldn't mind standing aside. I have many problems to unravel. \n\nThe Scriveners are always thrilled to challenge hopeful initiates, if you are looking for work.
Please, please, come! You look well-equipped, and the Syndicate could pay you for your time. \n\nI see that you are new to the island? Aid me, and perhaps I can shine some light on the darkness.
Fickle Fusions, Fanged Folly
Syndicate Initiation Quest: Aventus has hired you to lure the altered wolves to Midnight Den and destroy them, then meet him at the Syndicate Enclave to the north-east when you are finished.
"You offer knowledge?"

Yes, and the most valuable kind, indeed, if you assist! \n\nYou see, I've been testing alchemical lures on the local wolves. Results were promising, until one of the wolves consumed the bait... and grew in both size and ferocity.
"You're surprised the wolf ate your bait?"

I--well--expected that possibility, but not the precise nature of the reaction. \n\nWe must annihilate the creature. Place this lure in their den and fight until the alpha appears. Slay it, then meet me in the enclave for your reward.
Do not feel too sorry for the wolves. \n\nGiven the nature of the island, they are a menace in their best state.

Thank you for helping to resolve those, ah, unexpected consequences. We do important work here, studying Azoth's applications. But it is not without risks. \n\nPlease, come in. If you would, introduce yourself to Cleo.

Acquaintance of Aventus? His enthusiasm for research is admirable, but it creates complications from time to time. \n\nHe must make friends regularly. The Syndicate values those who help him uncomplicate his results.
"Tell me more about the Syndicate."

The Syndicate: scholars, arcanists, inventors, explorers of every kind. \n\nThis land suits the intellectually curious. Those who can handle a measure of danger, doubly so. You are welcome here. Return to Aventus.

After that mishap with the wolves, I must return to experimenting and trying anew. A different formula, or perhaps a new approach. \n\nFortunately, research is what this place was built for. What I am built for.
"The facilities are impressive."
You like them? If you join us in the Syndicate, they will be yours to use. \n\nShould you be interested, I would like to test your mind as well as your body.
Destroy the wolves for Aventus, and meet him at the Enclave.
Prepare for battle and place the lure in Midnight Den.
Travel north east to the Enclave
Fickle Fusions, Fanged Folly
Place the lure to draw the Pack
Defeat the Alpha Wolf and Pack
Defeat the Alpha Wolf: {remainingCount}/1 \nTime Remaining:
Remaining Wolves: {remainingCount}/2 \nTime Remaining:
Remaining Wolves: {remainingCount}/3 \nTime Remaining:
Seek out the Syndicate sanctum in north eastern Everfall.
Syndicate Enclave
Speak with Aventus at the Enclave
Introduce yourself to Cleo Elsayad

Azoth… the mysterious element that runs deep in this land. It is like nothing I ever experienced in the old world. Its potential applications are vast. \n\nOur very enclave itself is built near something quite special.
Over the Cliffs, and Through the Woods
Syndicate Initiation Quest: Aventus has tasked you to climb the cliffs nearby into Brightwood and east into the grove of the Azoth Tree to collect water from the moat, and then return to him.
"Special and dangerous?"
You're sharp! No progress comes without danger. \n\nTake this bottle, mind the cliffs, follow the path into Brightwood. Go through the grove, and then to the moat.
"You haven't told me what I'm looking for."

Consider that part of your test. You will know when you see it. \n\nOh, one more thing: do not anger the creatures there. You will find that discretion can often serve you far better than brute force.

Climb over the cliffs to the northeast. We have left markers as guides for the initiates. \n\nIf you attract unwanted attention, I recommend you hide or run. Sometimes the quickest route is draped in shadows.
Now you've seen the Azoth Tree. It was truly beautiful, no? Well worth a little danger. \n\nWelcome to Aeternum, my friend. You will have infinite time to take it in.
“The tree was certainly a marvel.”

I hoped you would see its true beauty. Now, if I may have the infused water, here is your payment. \n\nYou would make a marvelous member of the Syndicate. However, you must first see an additional member of our order.
Sneak through Brightgrove and collect the Azoth infused water.
Collect the Azoth-infused Water
Do Not Kill Any Angry Earth
We return to the tree often. \n\n Thank you for not disturbing the Angry Earth. Our trips are easier when they are less agitated.
It is a shame you had to engage the Angry Earth. \n\nI would not expect you to lay down and die, but it will be a tougher journey for some time. Pity.
Cleo has already requested a word, if you came back in one piece. I see within you the same potential. \n\nPlease, go and speak with her.
Woes of the Wise
Syndicate Initiation Quest: Aventus has asked you to speak with Cabalist Cleo Elsayad at the Syndicate Enclave for your final initiation test.
"I am willing to prove myself."
Oh, I believe you are. Go to her, and keep an open mind. \n\nThe task she has prepared may challenge you in more ways than one.
Go, and speak to Cleo. I eagerly await your return to the enclave.

Ah, a moment if you please. Thank you for speaking with me, Aventus has had much to say about you. \n\nOur order eagerly accepts capable candidates, and I hoped you would perform one final test to join our ranks. Shall we?
Speak with Cabalist Cleo Elsayad
The impermanence of death presents a peculiar conundrum when dealing with our adversaries. \n\nLet me ask you, how do you kill that which has no life? Well, we of the Syndicate aim to solve that.
Burden of Responsibility
Syndicate Initiation Quest: Cleo has requested that you travel to Broken Hull Hold, pour the sleeping draught into their wells, disrupt their reserves, and return to her at the Syndicate Enclave.
"New problems require new solutions."
Indeed. This is an Azoth-infused sleeping draught, with which I hope to subdue our immortal foes. \n\nPour it into the wells at Broken Hull Hold, and destroy their reserves to force them to drink it.
"How does sleeping solve the problem?"

Lost who sleep do not fight. If they do not fight, they do not die. Those who do not die… do not resurrect. \n\nThe old world likened death to slumber. We are going to turn that metaphor into reality.

It is a grim proposition, to be sure. But what should be done? \n\nGiven the horrific ways in which I have seen this problem approached, eternal slumber would be a blessing. We must all make difficult choices for the greater good.

You return victorious. You are truly committed to the application of knowledge, and not just its pursuit. \n\nDespite how you may feel about the act itself, do know that this work will help the people of Everfall.
“I hope you're right."
As do I. If I am not, we will simply try something else. \n\nShould you wish, we would be honored to have you join our ranks. Speak to Astrid when you're ready. She can begin your initiation.
Sabotage the Broken Hull Hold water supply
Travel south east to Broken Hull Hold
Pour the draught into the Northern Well
Pour the draught into the Southern Well
Collect Waterskins from the Lost
Destroy Water Barrel Reserves
Return to the Syndicate Enclave

I will return in time, to observe the effects of the sleeping draught and take samples. \n\nThank you for trusting in my experiment and aiding me. Maybe one day, we can save the Lost instead of pacifying them.
You are a curious sort, perhaps the precise catalyst the Syndicate needs. \n\nOne day, you will have to tell me what transpired on that beach. I've heard rumors, but nothing beats an eyewitness.
You have proven yourself an exemplary agent of the Syndicate, time and time again. \n\nIf you had been with me in the ruins of Brimstone… things might have been different.
Poor, poor Cleo always has something new on her mind. Discovery has hidden costs, and hers weigh heavily on her heart. \n\nThank you for helping her. She could use a friend.
Let us uncover wonderful new mysteries together. \n\nI am happy to call you a colleague, and hopefully, in time, a good friend.
This sanctum might not be here, if not for your efforts across Aeternum. \n\nIt may be hard to see at times, but even the tiniest actions help in the face of untold suffering. Thank you, friend!
UNUSED

The Syndicate is an eclectic group, one that would be honored to have you listed amongst our ranks. \n\nPlease, if you wish to join us in the pursuit of unraveling the mysteries of Aeternum, the time is now.
True Knowledge
Syndicate Recruitment Quest: You can now join the Syndicate.
“Alright. Where do I enlist?”
Now that is some joyous news. Your letters of recommendation have already been furnished. \n\nGo to Scrivener Astrid and she will process your records into our charters.
Please, go to Astrid. She already has your letters of recommendation in her files.
N/A
Pledge your allegiance to The Syndicate.
Speak with representative Astrid in the Syndicate Enclave and, should you desire, join the Syndicate.
(Optional) Decline their offer, for now.
"Thanks, but I'm still considering my options."

I understand. It is an important decision. Should you wish to join our ranks another time, return to my office and I can process your paperwork.

News of your adventures would be illuminating.

(You can talk to this representative again if you would like to join this faction. If you've already joined another faction, you may also now switch to this faction through the Bio menu.)
Tread softly.
Ah, you have that look about you. Does she speak to you as well? \n\nI hear the whispers of Aeternum. Not all are as blessed as we.
You're back. She said you'd be back.

When you've been around as long as I have, you start to wonder about the places you aren't supposed to be, the things you aren't supposed to see. \n\nWhat better place for that special wonder than the Syndicate!
People call me a scoundrel, but I haven't been this happy in ages. \n\nDo you know anyone that needs their pockets picked? A temple scouted? A house robbed? Give me a holler!
A newcomer! Care for a drink? \n\nI don't get many volunteers these days…
You're looking thirsty. Could I interest you in the latest homebrew? \n\nI'm getting few reports of ill effects this time!
How did she get that nickname, they think. \n\nThen, BANG! It hits them.
Aye, I am glad you joined us. \n\nNever forget the way you reacted when I fired that one round!
Should you wish to stalk about here freely, you must get approved by Cabalist Elsayad first. \n\n This is a sanctum, after all.
I'd ask you to reconsider your faction alignment, but according the the Pact we cannot recruit you for another {factionCooldownDays} days.
I'd ask you to reconsider your faction alignment, but according the the Pact we cannot recruit you for one more day.
Aventus came over here six times, to tell me about you and the wolves. Six. Times. \n\nI only needed the letter from Cleo. Should you wish to join us, it is but a pen stroke away.

Well, then, another fox finds the den. I expect to see your name on many papers these days. \n\nCare to bolster that reputation of yours some more? I also have equipment available, should you find the need.

Everything is in motion now. 

I need a fixer, and that means you. 

Or, perhaps you seek assignment to even greater conflict?
Their belief in justice is not misplaced. But we must forge our own justice... Lead. Shepherd. Step into my embrace. Let us protect Aeternum together.
Their belief in justice is not misplaced. But we must forge our own justice... Lead. Shepherd.
Step into my embrace. Let us protect Aeternum together.
This band of warriors could do well, if they seized their true potential. Treasure, wealth, power - all things you could offer, if you would join us…
This band of warriors could do well, if they seized their true potential.
Treasure, wealth, power - all things you could offer, if you would join us…
Do you endeavor to understand these worlds? Your potential? You think you've seen much with the Syndicate. I will show you so much more…
Do you endeavor to understand these worlds? Your potential?
You think you've seen much with the Syndicate. I will show you so much more…

Marauder: Trial of the Gladiator

Defeat the Lost and their leader, Pirate Lawrence of the Long Shadow to prove you're worthy to advance to the rank of Gladiator. Talk to Commander Silas at the Marauder Enclave when the task is complete.
"Can't be too hard. You made it."
Oh, a really smart tongue on this one. It's a shame I don't have time to make you eat those words.\n\nThis challenge should be punishment enough, anyhow. It's helpful to me either way if you fail.
"Just tell me what I have to do."

Seems you're in a hurry to experience a painful death. Fine.\n\nThe legendary warrior Lawrence of the Long Shadow now finds himself among the Lost. Defeat them, and destroy their camp while you're at it.

Fancy seeing you again, what are you up to? One of the trials I take it? Saw you talking with old Silas and thought I caught wind that you're looking for your next rank.\n\nI can give you a pointer if you tell me where she's sending you.
"She wants me to go to the Longshadow Enclave."
You're going to do what now? Longshadow Enclave, now that name rings a bell, and not the right sort of bell I'm afraid.\n\n I think I have some digging to do my friend.
Smart. You should make sure you're ready before facing Lawrence.\n\nCould take some time. Possibly forever.

Saw you speaking with Tibbs over there. Not sure that was what I had assigned but I bet you were getting help.\n\nDoesn't surprise me, he's just as useless as you are. Talk to him all you like you, it won't help you.
"Actually I defeated the Lost."
You defeated Lawrence? You? Bah, I knew I should have given you a tougher challenge.\n\nVery well, Gladiator. You may have dealt with them, but you're far from getting to be a true Marauder.
In the Longshadow Enclave:
Defeat Lawrence of the Long Shadow and the Lost in {POITags} to earn the rank of Gladiator
Defeat {targetName}
Defeat Lost
Marauder: Trial of the Ravager

<font color="#eaeaea">FACTION TRIAL QUEST</font>\nDefeat a clan of bears in Greyvale Grotto to advance to the rank of Ravager. Talk to Commander Silas at the Marauder Enclave when the task is complete.
"Unlikely, but tell me what I need to do."

Ha ha! Still cocky. But you're about to face a lesson in humility from the most vicious bear clan this side of Aeternum.\n\nGo to Greyvale Grotto and do your best to avoid getting mauled by Grimclaw. In the unlikely event you survive, you'll be a Ravager.
"Bears? How hard could that be?"
Huh? They're big massive bears! They'll kill you! Repeatedly. Until you give up.
Make your way to Greyvale Grotto in Brightwood. And try not to die.\n\nIt reflects poorly on all of us when Gladiators get eaten by wild beasts.
Back so soon? I assume you've come to concede. I suppose you can still serve under Tibbs' command, if he isn't too ashamed of you.
"Actually I've killed them all. Including Grimclaw."
What? You managed to kill them? Grimclaw, too? That beast bested me in my trials! How could someone like you manage to-- \n\nNo matter. The next trial will be your last, mark my words.
Go to {POITags} to defeat Grimclaw and his kin to Earn Rank of Ravager
Near Greyvale Grotto:
Cut down {targetName} in the surrounding area
Defeat Grimclaw and take a Trophy
Best {targetName}
You're on your next trial I see. I expect it wasn't a problem for you, you don't look worse for wear.\n\nWell not any worse than usual. What've you had to do?
"I had to slay Grimclaw, and basically the entire den in Greyvale Grotto."

You had to do what? Grimclaw? I heard that Silas had it out for you but I didn't know it was that bad. She shouldn't have set you such a task.\n\n I think my hunch was right. She's up to something. I just have to figure out what.
Marauder: Trial of the Destroyer
<font color="#eaeaea">FACTION TRIAL QUEST</font>\nDefeat the corrupted ex-marauders in the Great Cleave. Talk to Lieutenant Tibbs at the Marauder Enclave when the task is complete.
"And Florent fell to the Corruption?"

Unfortunately he did, we were the closest of companions, but due to events in the Great Cleave, he turned. He carried with him an amulet. \n\nSee if you could get that and return to me, report to Gladiator Strou'dahia anything you find.
"I'm sorry to hear about Florent."

When you're on Aeternum long enough you expect it can happen to anyone. Sometimes I just wish things had gone differently.\n\nAll the same, I appreciate you doing this. This will be your trial, though I wish it were a more heroic one.
Careful when you're out there, Great Cleave is treacherous even for someone as experienced as yourself.
You did it? You eliminated the Corrupted Marauders? And what of Florent?\n\nI assume you found him? Or rather… what might have been left of him.
"I told Gladiator Strou'dahia about it. Silas gave Florent the Corrupted Amulet."

She did? Blasted fool, I knew it. I should have never trusted her.\n\n This is what she's done then, set up our recruits for failure. You did well though. I just- I wish I had been able to see this and stop it before it happened.
Travel to Ostrog Maul and defeat the renegade Corrupted Marauders
In Ostrog Maul:
Defeat renegade Corrupted Marauders
Retrieve the Amulet from {targetName}
Read the journal of Ravager Florent
I see you have progressed well, far from when you started some time ago.\n\nI assume your training is going well then?
"I had to put down Florent and took this Corrupted amulet that Silas had given him."

Silas gave Florent a Corrupted amulet? This is disconcerting.\n\n He was one of the best we had in the Marauders, and yet he fell to the Corruption, no doubt part of her intentions. I will speak with Silas.
Though your journey has been difficult, you have handled it well. Silas has much to account for.\n\nBut you will not have to worry about that. You may celebrate your victories now.
Marauder: Trial of the Commander

<font color="#eaeaea">FACTION TRIAL QUEST</font>\nDefeat Corrupted Commander Silas and return the corrupted amulet to prove you're worthy to advance to the rank of Commander. Talk to Lieutenant Tibbs at the Marauder Enclave when the task is complete.
"Silas has fallen to the Corruption?"

Silas has gone down a path no Marauder should choose to tread. She is Corrupted, and now must be dealt with. From her I need an amulet she stole from Tibbs.\n\n It is what I believe what gave her the ability to become Corrupted and it must be returned to us for safeguarding.
"So defeat her and bring back the amulet?"

Yes, the anger and callous soul within her led her to this, but the amulet enabled her. The relic was cursed from the beginning but the Corruption found a way to her through that.\n\n Bring back the amulet, prove yourself worthy of being a Commander.

Our task is grim, but the Marauders must sometimes do the difficult thing, even when they are dealing with those we did not like.\n\nSilas was a Marauder, and a good one for all her faults. But allowing the Corruption to overtake you is inexcusable.

It is done then? Ah yes, this amulet is a symbol of your accomplishment. From beginning to end, you have served as an exemplar of the tenets of the Marauders.\n\nLet this be a lesson to all those who strive for greatness in the Marauders.
"I strive my best to be a Marauder."

Very good, Commander. I am glad to have you amongst our ranks. A leader, truly.\n\nBut let us not forget Silas, she serves as an example as well, the path of darkness. The path that those who seek strength alone may fall into, that we all may fall into, if we are not vigilant.
Defeat the Corrupted Commander Silas and retrieve the signet ring in {POITags} to earn the rank of Commander
Defeat {targetName}
Collect the Corrupted Amulet
I still can't believe she stole it, my only memory of Florent.\n\nHe was the best of us and it was a way for me to remember the old days we spent together.
"She took it from you?"

She took it while I wasn't looking. Distracted me when she came over here, said something about how it would make her stronger.\n\nCouldn't figure what that meant, all I care about it the memory of my comrade.
Marauder: Trial of the Champion

<font color="#eaeaea">FACTION TRIAL QUEST</font>\nBrave the dangers of Brimstone Sands and Hornhold to prove you're worthy to advance to the rank of Champion. Talk to Gladiator Strou'dahia at the Marauder Enclave when the task is complete.
"I am always ready for a new challenge."
As a Commander of the Marauder, you have the chance to become one of the very best of the Marauders.\n\nBut I have a new trial, a station that has not been achieved for generations. A true Champion.
"A champion?"

Yes, and you will prove it by hunting three of the most dangerous adversaries in Aeternum. The Khelone Khelydorea, the Colossus of Qebui, and Sividus the Armored Drake.\n\nFrom each you will claim a trophy and prove yourself worthy of the title of Champion of the Marauders.
Many have failed at this trial, so I do not have to tell you twice to think with a keen mind and a cautious eye.\n\nThe rest, well that is up to you.

I see you have spoken with Tibb. The look on his face was all that I needed. I can see you have returned a Champion.\n\nThe trophies in your possession, I will take them. Though we may not display them, you will know what you have accomplished.
"I proved myself, and earned my title."

That you did, it is done, and you have earned this right. You are now a Champion of the Marauders.\n\nIt is usually a cause for celebration, but given the grim situation of the fall of First Light, perhaps we will save the celebrations until later.
You've done a great deal for the Marauders. Did I hear right that you started the Trial of the Champion?\n\nYou know that's a rare opportunity, not many get the chance to even participate.
"I just defeated them actually."
Hah! That doesn't surprise me one bit. You haven't faltered at any challenges thrown your way.\n\nLet any Marauder argue against your worthiness and you'll have a hundred more singing your praises.
Collect the coins at Hornhold and defeat the Armored Drake in {POITags} to earn the rank of Champion
Collect the Trophies of the Legendary Adversaries
Go to the Pools of Orcus to find and defeat the Khelone Khelydorea
Go to the ruins and defeat the Colossus of Qebui
Go to Hornhold to find and defeat Sividus

Defeat the {targetName} and claim their trophy
Defeat {targetName} and claim their trophy

Syndicate: Trial of the Scrivener

<font color="#eaeaea">FACTION TRIAL QUEST</font>\nDefeat Lost Gheist Malikor and use the Psychokinetic Absorber to capture any ectoplasm to earn the rank of Scrivener. Talk to Alchemist Krockes at the Syndicate Enclave when the task is complete.
"I am. What must I do?"
You have arrived at the perfect moment, for I am ready to test my new Psychokinetic Absorber.\n\nDid you know that some of the Lost still possess small traces of their souls?
"Are you sure about that?"

Yes. We just proved the hypothesis by examining one of our Lost captives. Find Gheist Malikor. He was quite formidable in life, so be wary.\n\nUse the Psychokinetic Absorber and strike him down. You'll see!
Have you located Malikor yet? He's somewhere out there.\n\nUse the Absorber and bring back the traces of his soul!
Ah, at last! Yes, yes, you see? There are traces of Malikor's soul in here! This changes EVERYTHING!\n\nThis device will surely cause a revolution in our studies of the Lost!
"Does this mean I'm a Scrivener now?"
Ah right yes! You have done well, and I am pleased to promote you to the rank of Scrivener!\n\nGreat well, now I must study these results, the work never ends my friend!
Capture Ectoplasm and Soul Traces from Lost Gheist Malikor at {POITags} to Earn Rank of Scrivener

Syndicate: Trial of the Chronicler

<font color="#eaeaea">FACTION TRIAL QUEST</font>\nGather ectoplasm and soul traces from the various Lost in Periville and return to Alchemist Krockes at the Syndicate Enclave to earn the rank of Chronicler.
"Yes. Will you administer my trial again?"
After our first success? Of course! I consider you a most audacious companion! \n\nGather up specimens from Periville, and let us repeat our experiment on a new subject.
"How is this different from the first time?"

Ah- well you see, I've made some slight adjustments. This shouldn't be anything noticeable in the appearance, but rest assured it is improved.\n\nJust don't go shaking it around too much, still a bit finnicky at times.
Gather the specimens for our work in the Fen, and then I will see you advanced in rank.
Really? You got all of it? And rather quickly too, I think.\n\nYour abilities once again prove you are an invaluable resource!
"Happy to help."
With these in hand, the things we might accomplish are innumerable! I just need time.\n\nAnd for your contribution, you have earned your new rank. Congratulations, Chronicler {playerName}.
In Periville:
Gather ectoplasm and soul traces from the various Lost in Periville

Syndicate: Trial of the Cabalist

<font color="#eaeaea">FACTION TRIAL QUEST</font>\nPlace Psychokinetic Absorbers at strategic points in Mourningdale to earn the rank of Cabalist. Talk to Alchemist Krockes at the Syndicate Enclave when the task is done.
"Is everything doing okay, Alchemist Krockes?"
Oh right yes of course, I am doing perfectly well. I just was distracted.\n\nIt matters not, we have yet another prototype to test. This time, a unique one that must be tested in Mourningdale!
"And what shall I do?"

The devices are going to be placed, but I will gather them myself. Activate them if you will in the strategic points along Mourningdale's leylines.\n\nYou're no stranger to these devices, I believe it should go swimmingly. Ah yes-- as well, additional specimen will need to be gathered.
Those Psychokinetic Absorbers won't place themselves.\n\nThe sooner, the better. The research never ends, my friend!
Perfect! Perfect! You have accomplished quite the feat, and this harvest will be invaluable to me-- and the Syndicate of course.\n\nBut I must collect them, yes I must soon.
"Are you certain everything is okay?"
Yes, yes, you deserve this. I mean, your title. We will be remembered for all time in our accomplishments, no matter what Cleo says!\n\nEr- and you are a Cabalist too now! Congratulations.

Syndicate: Trial of the Alchemist

<font color="#eaeaea">FACTION TRIAL QUEST</font>\nDefeat Alchemist Krockes and absorb his soul into the Psychokinetic Absorber and then return it to Cleo Elsayad to earn the rank of Alchemist. Talk to Cleo Elsayad at the Syndicate Enclave when the task is complete.
"How did it happen?"

The way it always does with the undisciplined. Too enamored of their research and their reputation.\n\nKrockes was simply not strong-minded enough. You are ready to face your final trial, are you not?
"I am. What must I do?"
You must learn to clean up the messes you've made.\n\nKrockes is not only Lost, he's harnessing soul power. He must be destroyed. Immediately. It's the only way to set things right.
When you find Krockes, don't hesitate. I suspect he has become quite… volatile.
Then the deed is done? Krockes is no more? Well done!\n\nThe integrity of our research must be preserved. You have served with distinction and earned the rank of Alchemist. Congratulations!
"I am. What must I do?"
You must learn to clean up the messes you've made.\n\nKrockes is not only Lost, he's harnessing soul power. He must be destroyed. Immediately. It's the only way to set things right.
Use Psychokinetic Absorber on Alchemist Krockes in {POITags}
Place the Psychokinetic Absorber
Defeat {targetName}
Collect the Psychokinetic Absorber
Destroy the Psychokinetic Absorber with the aid of the Dryads
Syndicate: Trial of the Magus

<font color="#eaeaea">FACTION TRIAL QUEST</font>\nVenture to Tempestas Custodia to obtain the work of Syndicate Researcher Sigurdsson and return it to Cleo Elsayad to earn the rank of Magus. Talk to Cleo Elsayad at the Syndicate Enclave when the task is complete.
"Examined how?"

Ah yes, well you see there had been Syndicate researchers dispatched to study these sites. One of particular interest was called Tempestas Custodia.\n\nA researcher named Sigurdsson volunteered to delve further into the site.
"And what happened to Sigurdsson?"

You see, he has not been heard from in some time. On Aeternum we must assume the worst, but the research he was performing is invaluable. I have no doubt he would wish for us to preserve his findings.\n\nTravel to Tempestas Custodia in Elysian Wilds and locate his research.
Sigurdsson was a fine researcher, but I do wonder if he was in over his head in the Elysian Wilds.\n\nThe Syndicate's mission often requires us to visit such untamed lands.

Well done, I knew that you were someone who could be trusted with such a monumental task. You will be named a Magus immediately.\n\nAnd, of course, so shall Sigurdsson, should he ever return. Hope springs eternal here in Aeternum, after all.
"And what happened to Sigurdsson?"

Covenant: Trial of the Templar

<font color="#eaeaea">FACTION TRIAL QUEST</font>\nTrack down the Apostate Covenant Initiate Bremen Luca and attempt to discover what happened to him to advance to the rank of Templar. Talk to Templar Roose at the Covenant Enclave when the task is complete.
"I am ready. What do I do?"

One of our number - an Initiate like yourself - has asked some uncomfortable questions. Questions that, I'm afraid, we cannot allow.\n\nHe has been named an Apostate. And it seems in his despair that he's fallen Lost. We must lay him to his final rest.
"Lay him to rest?"

Yes, it's grim business to be certain, yet we must complete it with dignity. He was of our number and though he became Lost, we shall remember him.\n\nIf you can, bring back any tokens or memories for his next of kin.
Find the Apostate and offer him his final rest.\n\nMay he at last find peace, at least for some time.

Ah, you have returned! I have taken over the Trial. Adjudicator Roose is otherwise occupied.\n\nI am Livia Luca, Covenant Adjudicator. If that name sounds familiar it is because I am the mother of Bremen Luca.
"I found his journal pages."

I see. These pages are from my son you say? Unfortunately, our leadership's judgment is final.\n\nThank you for retrieving my son's last testament, Templar. I will have to read through them, there is quite a bit I must make sense of.
Track down Apostate Luca in {POITags} to Earn Rank of Templar

<font color="#eaeaea">FACTION TRIAL QUEST</font>\nFind the second page of the journal of Bremen Luca to advance to the rank of Excubitor. Talk to Livia Luca at the Covenant Enclave when the task is complete.
"What did his journals say?"

Something of grave concern. My son was named an Apostate, yet he was not the only one excommunicated from the Covenant.\n\nI fear this runs deeper than I thought. I believe that there was something of a conspiracy against my son.
"Should we bring this up with the leadership?"

No, unfortunately it is one, if not more, of them who are responsible for condemning Bremen to begin with. This will be your next trial. Go to Weaver's Fen and find my son's journal.\n\nBring back any evidence you find. And please, keep this between us.
Travel the Fen and find what my son was investigating. Then I will grant you the rank of Excubitor.\n\nRemember, we must not tell the others.
You found this page? And… prayer beads? These are beads of the Covenant. That must mean these were once Covenant members.\n\n I'm afraid this has much darker implications than I originally thought.
"What do you believe this means?"

There must be someone responsible, but who? I apologize that this is not your normal trial you were expecting. But rest assured that you are an Excubitor now.\n\nWell done, and we will talk more soon I expect.
Track down Bremen Luca's journal in {POITags} to Earn Rank of Excubitor

<font color="#eaeaea">FACTION TRIAL QUEST</font>\nFind Bremen Luca's journal at Hollowing Fort and recover Prayer Beads from Corrupted Templars to earn the rank of Lumen. Talk to Adjudicator Luca at the Covenant Enclave when the task is complete.
"Yes, I am prepared."

I have continued piecing together the fragments of my son's journals. He found more evidence. He mentioned someone by the name of Templar Ambrose who went to Great CLeave.\n\nI'm not familiar with the name but I need you to find out more. With him lies the answers.
"I'll visit Templar Ambrose in Great Cleave"

I suspect he may have more of my son's writings. It's almost as if Bremen was leaving us a trail.\n\nIf you can, bring back more prayer beads as proof Templar Ambrose has fallen to the Corruption. I believe we are close to the answers we seek.
Your help has been invaluable to me, and to the entire Covenant.\n\nWe will uncover the truth, and your valor will be recognized. But first, we must find the evidence.

This was when he discovered about some of the leaders, then. He uncovered the fallen of the Covenant, and they punished him for seeking the truth.\n\nIt all started with this Templar Ambrose, his fall started Bremen's own path.
"I'm sorry for what happened."

You have helped make things right. I'd expect nothing less from a Lumen of the Covenant.\n\nI will resolve to find an end to this. I will find out who was responsible, exactly who is to blame for this. Thank you, Lumen, you are dismissed.

<font color="#eaeaea">FACTION TRIAL QUEST</font>\nLay Corrupted Adjudicator Luca to rest and find Adjudicator Roose to earn the rank of Adjudicator. Talk to Lethold at the Covenant Enclave when the task is complete.
"Livia Luca? What happened?"

Our scouts report that she has turned to the Corruption. If that is the case, she must be dealt with, and it may mean that Adjudicator Roose is in peril as well.\n\nThis is no mean task, but... you must track down Luca.
"I must face her?"

Indeed. She is... Was... a member of the Covenant. But our justice must be swift if she has turned.\n\nAnd if Adjudicator Roose is with her, we need to ensure her safety. This will be your next trial. And it is of the utmost importance.
I am sobered by the notion that Luca might have fallen, but we must do what is necessary for the Covenant.\n\nMay justice be swift for those who turn to the Corruption.
It's done, then? Perhaps she will find peace in death.\n\nAnd I see that Adjudicator Roose has returned. You have done what has been asked of you and more.
"I did right by the Covenant. What will become of Luca's legacy?"

She was a member of the Covenant, as was her son. But they have illuminated areas where we must reform. We will address this clear vendetta against Bremen with our leaders, and I will address those who conspired against him.\n\nHis legacy lives on. He was an exemplar of good, a lesson to us all. All we can do now is strive to save those who are left.

Yes. There are many things we do not know, but what is certain is that we have no communication with those left at Old First Light.\n\nI fear the worst has happened.

Travel there and investigate. I had only a letter from someone by the name of Simon Jeffrey who says he was assisting the Covenant's cause there with someone named Rotgut./n/nI have no idea what this might mean, but please, find out what you can and return with whatever evidence you can gather.
Be on your guard out in the Elysian Wilds. Much has changed out there and some truly formidable enemies now prowl the wildlands.\n\nKeep a sharp eye.
What have you found about the settlement in Old First Light?/n/nWho was this Simon Jeffrey and Rotgut?

I am concerned what this means for the future of that settlement, but I am grateful for the answers that we have./n/nYou have shown true mettle in the face of danger in the Elysian Wilds. You have proven yourself worthy. You are a true Paragon of the Covenant.
